'Are you really going to give her this?'%K%P
'Of course. If we follow this plan we'll be\nfinished in no time!'%K%P
Maika winked, full of confidence. I couldn't say\nI shared her enthusiasm for the schedule she'd\ncreated.%K%P
Even after reducing it to the bare minimum, it\nwould still cut Akane's free time in half.%K%P
Throwing this at her out of nowhere might not\nend well.%K%P
'Akane, do you have a minute?'%K%P
'Huh? What is it.'%K%P
'Here.'%K%P
Akane was laying down, as usual, but Maika\nstrode forward and handed her the stack of\npapers she'd just written up.%K%P
'What's this?'%K%P
'It's your new rehabilitation schedule. I know\nit looks like a lot, but I'll be here with you\nevery step of the way.'%K%P
Akane glanced over the schedule. She didn't look\nimpressed.%K%P
Since Maika had started 'helping', Akane had\ngone along with her suggestions without\ncomplaining.%K%P
But now...%K%P
'Let's go, Akane. We've got cleaning to attend\nto.'%K%P
'Aw, but so much has happened lately, can't I at\nleast take today off?'%K%P
'Maika, one day won't hurt, right? Akane has\nbeen working hard.'%K%P
'No deal. I want to help reform Akane and save\nTsubaki ASAP. Even one day can make all the\ndifference.'%K%P
Maika tried to hurry Akane into getting up, but\nthe goddess didn't move.%K%P
'Akane? Come on, hurry up and--'%K%P
'No.'%K%P
'Huh?'%K%P
'I said no. I don't wanna.'%K%P
'C-Come on, Akane. If we don't properly\nrehabilitate you, Tsubaki will--'%K%P
'I don't care! Sho does his best for my sake, so\nI don't mind trying hard for him.'%K%P
'But all you care about is yourself. It's no fun\nhere anymore! If this is how you want this house\nto be, I won't lift a finger to save it!'%K%P
'What?! You're just going to let it disappear?!'%K%P
'Yeah, why not? I don't care about it anymore.'%K%P
'Akane...you're really starting to cross the\nline!'%K%P
'Hey now, you two, let's all keep cool--'%K%P
'You stay out of this, Sho!'%K%P
'I'm doing everything I can for this place and\nfor you, Akane. Take back what you said!'%K%P
'No, it's the truth. I'll feel bad for you two\nif you lose this place, but that doesn't mean\nyou can do whatever you want to me.'%K%P
'How can you say that? You're supposed to be\nTsubaki's household goddess!'%K%P
'Fine, I'll quit! Then it won't matter if I do\nget demoted to being a spirit!'%K%P
'Whoa! Hey, Akane!'%K%P
Akane got up and left, ignoring us when we tried\nto call her back.%K%P
'Maika, I think you went too far.'%K%P
'But I... I'm sorry. I need to go cool my head a\nlittle.'%K%P
Her voice was trembling as she walked away and\nleft me alone in the living room.%K%P
After their fight, Akane and Maika made a point\nof avoiding or ignoring each other.%K%P
Maika was so on edge I was afraid to say\nanything.%K%P
'What am I supposed to do?'%K%P
'Sho.'%K%P
'Inori?'%K%P
I was in my room trying to think of a solution\nwhen Inori came to visit.%K%P
'There's something I need to talk to you about.\nMay I come in?'%K%P
'Of course.'%K%P
'Thank you.'%K%P
'Feel free to sit wherever.'%K%P
She sat down facing me, her posture stiff and\nformal.%K%P
'You said you needed to talk?'%K%P
'Akane and Maika both seem irritated. Did\nsomething happen between them?'%K%P
Well, she was bound to ask.%K%P
I told Inori all about the fight between Akane\nand Maika.%K%P
'I see. That explains their behavior.'%K%P
'I feel responsible. If I'd seen this coming a\nlittle sooner...'%K%P
'It's not your fault. But this might pose quite\na serious problem.'%K%P
'Yeah, Akane's going to lose interest in her\nrehabilitation again.'%K%P
'Well, that's part of it, yes. But it could be\neven worse if Akane really does resign her\nposition as household goddess.'%K%P
'What would be so bad about that?'%K%P
'Just as I have a duty to watch over Kannagi\nTown, Akane's role is to protect Tsubaki\nApartments from misfortune and disaster.'%K%P
'These duties are important for us goddesses. It\ndidn't seem relevant before, but allow me to\nmake something clear.'%K%P
'If Akane really does unceremoniously quit being\na household goddess, she will definitely be\ndemoted to spirit status.'%K%P
'What? Just from quitting her job?'%K%P
'I do not believe our boss would show mercy to a\ngoddess that has abandoned her duties.'%K%P
'Tsubaki is a very old building. The reason it's\nsurvived so long is because of its household\ngoddess's protection, meager though it may be.'%K%P
'Even if it avoids demolition, without that\ndivine protection it will age rapidly and may\neven fall apart on its own.'%K%P
I couldn't let that happen.%K%P
I had no idea Akane's power over this place was\nso important.%K%P
On the other hand...%K%P
'Can she really quit just like that, though?'%K%P
'Normally, no. But Akane is an Aragami. Her\npower tends to respond directly to her desires.'%K%P
'If she truly wishes to cease being a household\ngoddess, it may very well become so.'%K%P
Inori stopped for breath while I tried to take\nall of it in.%K%P
This was more serious than I thought.%K%P
'Thank you for telling me.'%K%P
'I only did what I had to. I love living here at\nTsubaki Apartments with all of you so much.'%K%P
'So I really don't want it to end like this.'%K%P
'Me too. I won't let all our efforts go to\nwaste.'%K%P
'In that case, I will leave the rest to you.'%K%P
'Sure. I'll find a way to keep everyone happy.'%K%P
I was determined to do whatever it would take.%K%P
